Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Assassin \As*sas"sin\, n. [F. (cf. It. assassino), fr. Ar. `hashishin one who has drunk of the hashish. Under its influence the Assassins of the East, followers of the Shaikh al-Jabal (Old Man of the Mountain), were said to commit the murders required by their chief.] One who kills, or attempts to kill, by surprise or secret assault; one who treacherously murders any one unprepared for defense. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Assassin \As*sas"sin\, v. t. To assassinate. [Obs.] --Stillingfleet. [1913 Webster]

assassin n 1: a murderer (especially one who kills a prominent political figure) who kills by a treacherous surprise attack and often is hired to do the deed; "his assassins were hunted down like animals"; "assassinators of kings and emperors" [syn: {assassinator}, {bravo}] 2: a member of a secret order of Muslims (founded in the 12th century) who terroriszed and killed Christian Crusaders
